snippet: In milliseconds, a roach can flip under a ledge by swinging its body around like a pendulum and hanging on underneath with hooklike claws. Scientists are trying to copy that agility in a robot.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS One finds that cockroaches can flip under a ledge by swinging their bodies around like a pendulum and hanging on underneath; researchers note that the movement occurs so quickly that the insects seem to disappear.
lead_paragraph: In milliseconds, a roach can flip under a ledge by swinging its body around like a pendulum and hanging on underneath with hooklike claws. Scientists are trying to copy that agility in a robot.
